name: Variable Watermilfoil

Identifying Characteristics: Submersed bottle brush appearing aquatic plant
Stems: sturdy, often reddish but sometimes green, up to 4m long
Leaves: green, finely feather divided leaves with 5-14 leaflet pairs in whorls of 4-6, internodal space less than 5mm
Flowers: June to September, in whorls on emergent stalk with bracts (toothed margins), flowers smaller than bracts, white, minute
Other: hybridizes with Myriophyllum laxum; hybrid is present in Maine:
Biology: Reproduction by seed rare outside native range
Habitat: Well adapted – still and flowing water, under ice
Various substrates – organic muck, silt, sand, gravel
Range: Northeast US Range: Maine, all northeast states

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
